meanings.definition: Fail to give a true impression of (something).
meanings.sent1: Her smile can belie her true feelings.
meanings.sent2: The calm exterior of the lake can belie its dangerous currents.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks can belie reality.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors belie the stormy weather ahead.
meanings.sent5: The old house may belie its true age with a fresh coat of paint.

meanings.sent1: His cheerful tone can belie his inner sadness.
meanings.sent2: The politician's words belie his true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy can belie its mischievous nature.
meanings.sent4: The calm sea can belie the storm brewing beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent can belie the poisonous nature of the flower.
